programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: A narrow and harsh belt of western coastline in southern Africa is a land of contrasts where creatures are forced to adapt to survive. Meet the quirky and charismatic inhabitants that call this fragile interplay between land and ocean home.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Roam through South Africa's Greater Kruger Park with a baby lioness and the pride that must fight off the predators threatening its territory. Will the cub learn the skills to hunt and survive the dangers hiding in the shadows?

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: As humans take up more space, the baboons of Africa must adapt. Travel across the continent to watch them form unbreakable social bonds, serve to protect their families and survive a changing landscape.

programme.title: Into The Wild India
programme.desc: One of the most iconic animals on Earth stalks the jungles of India: the Bengal Tiger. Over the course of a single day, follow the fortunes of one mother and her three young cubs as she forages for food and fights to keep her family safe and alive.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how one animal family's tragedy is another's holiday dinner as New Zealand's mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Leave the river behind and stalk the valley's grasslands. Explore territory that's home to a troop of baboons, a family of warthogs, and a solitary female leopard named Olimba. Check in with a nesting family of storks and fend off wild dogs at night.

programme.desc: A narrow and harsh belt of western coastline in southern Africa is a land of contrasts where creatures are forced to adapt to survive. Meet the quirky and charismatic inhabitants that call this fragile interplay between land and ocean home.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered why mandrills have such colourful faces, why vultures are bald, or even why hammerheads have, well, hammer-shaped heads? Discover how animals managed to survive by evolving from the neck up.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: In geological and biological scales, humans have only been around for the blink of an eye, and yet we've managed to influence the evolutionary path for many animals. Explore the human impact on dogs, wolves, coyotes, elephants, and more.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: A teenage toque macaque has led an idyllic life in the ancient Sri Lankan temples his troop calls home. But as adulthood approaches, he'll soon have to leave the safety of the ruins and find a new troop. Join his journey into a daunting new world.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Roam through South Africa's Greater Kruger Park with a baby lioness and the pride that must fight off the predators threatening its territory. Will the cub learn the skills to hunt and survive the dangers hiding in the shadows?

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: As humans take up more space, the baboons of Africa must adapt. Travel across the continent to watch them form unbreakable social bonds, serve to protect their families and survive a changing landscape.

programme.title: Undiscovered Vistas
programme.desc: Learn about the world's largest volcanic island, a lone and rugged place where steam escapes, water explodes, and new ground is born every day. See how fire and ice collide in a battle that makes this the most geologically powerful island on earth.

programme.title: Undiscovered Vistas
programme.desc: Tour an island built by volcanoes, but sculpted by ice. About 1.5 million years ago, a sheet of ice descended from the north and covered the land. Today, massive glaciers continue to carve marine cliffs and cut down mountains.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted aerials of Chile's beautiful Atacama Desert. Soar over the desert landscape rich with mountains,salt lakes, geysers, flamingos and guanacos.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Some of the most interesting adaptations in the animal world are completely invisible. Study these hidden, internal alterations to see how different animals have evolved to survive in amazing and unseen ways.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Why do zebras have stripes? How do penguins see underwater? And why are a tree frog's eyes red? In this exploration of sight, discover how some animals have evolved to see extremely well while others have evolved to be nearly invisible.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: Across rippled dunes, in the wind-swept grasslands of the southern Kalahari towers a magnificent Camelthorn. It has stood here for two centuries. This tree is never lonely, learn how it provides food, shelter and a hunting ground to many creatures.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: For most of the year it's a desert, but during early August and September the dusty valleys of Namaqualand transform into a wonderland carpeted with wildflowers. Witness this magnificent transformation from arid desert to beautiful oasis.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Track a cheetah mom and her four babies through their fragile first year of life in the savannah of the Waterberg Biosphere Reserve in South Africa. Find out how they learn which species are food and how to avoid becoming another animal's dinner.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: Off the coast of Tanzania, baby Kima lives with his family of red colobus monkeys. But what happens when he loses his way? Discover how this little monkey learns to adapt to life in the jungle-and find out if he can reconnect with his family again.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: The instinct to protect young ones is hard to suppress. Marvel at the way animals, both male and female, care for babies of other species. Meet a lonely rabbit who babysits lambs, and a little rescued rhino who finds encouragement from a playful dog.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Celebrate the first day of spring with Aussie creatures looking for either a dinner or a date. From the kangaroos in the grasslands to the koalas in the trees to the freshwater crocodiles, they hunt for food or fight for breeding rights.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Meet the unique primates and reptiles searching for water and dodging predators, from ring-tailed lemurs in the east coast rainforests to tiny brown leaf chameleons, in this land of extreme climate variations and habitats.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Discover the majesty of the US's most northern state. Shot in stunning HDR, travel from the breathtaking coves and bays of Baranof Island, to the Glacier Bay where humpback and killer whales navigate among towering glaciers and soaring mountains.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: Roatan is known for its climate, white sandy beaches-and shipwrecks. From the decades-old Prince Albert to the newly-sunken Odyssey and Mr. Bud, explore artificial marine habitats at various stages of development.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: From opportunistic pirate ships to well-armed navy vessels, the Yucatan Peninsula is home to a variety of reef wrecks. With moray eels, schools of rays, and thousands of other creatures, these sunken ships have become vibrant marine habitats.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of Chile's stunning Atacama Desert. Discover the rich landscape of wide desert valleys and towering mountains.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Cooperation comes in many forms. Some animals cooperate to be social while others put the welfare of the group above their own reproductive potential. See the many ways species have evolved to work with one another in order to survive.

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution
programme.desc: Some call them "living fossils," but that's just another way to say survivors. From the shark to the horseshoe crab, these animals' early adaptations were a success, leaving them relatively unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: Discover the story of the much loved Sausage Tree, whose nectar filled blooms and sausage shaped fruits entice animals of all kinds, from insects to elephants. See how the very animals who rely on this generous tree ensure its proliferation.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: This small park makes a big difference to endangered animals. Offering sanctuary to some of the biggest and smallest animals on the planet, witness how species come back from the edge of extinction to reclaim their place in Africa's wilderness.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: Many species call Zambia's Luangwa Valley home, but it has one of the toughest dry seasons imaginable-no rain for seven months and extreme temperatures. Yet for some animals, the dry season means opportunity.

programme.title: Baboons: Rules Of The Troop
programme.desc: Follow four different baboon families-a resourceful beach troop, the warlike desert troop, the disciplined river troop, and the peaceful mountain band-to find out why these primates are among the most successful animals in Africa.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the planet's most dramatic natural shifts in July, from the Arctic ice sheets that come crashing down during the summer melt to the feeding frenzy when sockeye salmon reach the end of their journey in Alaska.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the world to see another seasonal change unfold. The Northern Hemisphere moves into autumn, while Australia witnesses a rebirth of life, and mating humpbacks fill the warming tropical seas of Tonga.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth

programme.desc: The race is on to find Tulia and Zalipa, who are missing from Palas Island. And after months of convalescence, Beni returns to forest school but faces another setback at the milk bucket. Meanwhile, the vets keep a close eye on pregnant Dilla.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: The fate of several graduates awaits the next round of wild releases. Meanwhile, runaway Zalipa is found, but her partner in crime, Tulia, is still missing. And Baby Clarita has a complete meltdown as the vets perform surgery on her mother.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted geysers in Chile's Atacama Desert.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Endure a dose of danger as animals battle in an isolated tropical forest on this African island. See female lemurs carry their offspring for protection, hold on for dear life with panther chameleons, and smash heads with giraffe weevils.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Journey to this island continent, where exotic locales are brutal battlegrounds for survival. Learn to throw punches with a kangaroo, dance with peacock spiders trying to get attention, and meet tiny fiddler crabs just itching to get in a fight.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: In a misty South African forest grows a six hundred year old Outeniqua Yellowwood. At forty meters tall, she towers above the canopy and is one of the few remaining of her kind. Follow her captivating story, unique as the ecosystem in her branches.
